arm_group.description: group PI were performed periarticular drug injection during surgery.
group FI were performed fascia iliaca block  before surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
In this study, the aim is to compare the efficacy of Periarticular multimodal  drug
      injection(group PI) and Fascia Iliaca Compartment Block ( group FI)for total knee
      arthroplasty.

clinical_study.brief_title: Periarticular Injection Versus Fascia Iliaca Block for Total Knee Arthroplasty

detailed_description.textblock:
Total knee arthroplasty is very painful surgical intervention.Patients were assigned to 2
      groups to receive either periarticular multimodal  drug injection or fascia iliaca
      compartment block for postoperative pain.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients undergoing knee arthroplasty

          -  > 18 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  obesity

          -  heart failure

          -  kidney failure

          -  liver failure

intervention.description: patients were performed bupivacaine solution to the periarticular soft tissues during surgery by the surgeon.
patients were performed fascia iliaca block with bupivacaine solution before surgery.

facility.name: Baskent University School of Medicine Adana Teaching and reserach Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Multimodal Periarticular Injection Versus Fascia Iliaca Compartment Block for Total Knee Arthroplasty

primary_outcome.description: Patients were  assigned in two groups to perform  either periarticular injection (group PI) and fascia block ( group FB). They were accessed by visual analog scale. The aim was to compare the efficacy and side effects of periarticular injection and fascia block.
primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative pain scores of periarticular injection and fascia block for total knee arthroplasty

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Caregiver, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
